inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Only compatible with models that are capable of function calling: ChatOpenAI, ChatMistral, ChatAnthropic, ChatGoogleGenerativeAI, ChatVertexAI, GroqChat

inputAnchors.label: Agent Memory
inputAnchors.name: agentMemory
inputAnchors.description: Save the state of the agent

inputAnchors.label: State
inputAnchors.name: state
inputAnchors.description: State is an object that is updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

data.label: ChatOpenAI
data.name: chatOpenAI
data.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

inputParams.label: Stop Sequence
inputParams.name: stopSequence
inputParams.description: List of stop words to use when generating. Use comma to separate multiple stop words.

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Allow image input. Refer to the docs for more details.

inputParams.label: Image Resolution
inputParams.description: This parameter controls the resolution in which the model views the image.
inputParams.name: imageResolution

outputAnchors.name: chatOpenAI
outputAnchors.label: ChatOpenAI
outputAnchors.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

data.label: State
data.name: seqState
data.description: A centralized state object, updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another

tabs.label: Custom State (Table)
tabs.name: stateMemoryUI
tabs.description: Structure for state. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
Specify the Key, Operation Type, and Default Value for the state object. The Operation Type can be either "Replace" or "Append".

**Replace**
- Replace the existing value with the new value.
- If the new value is null, the existing value will be retained.

**Append**
- Append the new value to the existing value.
- Default value can be empty or an array. Ex: ["a", "b"]
- Final value is an array.

tabs.label: Custom State (Code)
tabs.name: stateMemoryCode

outputAnchors.name: seqState
outputAnchors.label: State
outputAnchors.description: A centralized state object, updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another

outputAnchors.name: mySQLAgentMemory

outputAnchors.description: Memory for agentflow to remember the state of the conversation using MySQL database

data.label: Condition Agent
data.name: seqConditionAgent

inputParams.label: System Prompt
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.default:
You are an expert customer support routing system.
Your job is to detect whether a customer support representative is routing a user to the technical support team, or just responding conversationally.

inputParams.label: Conversation History
inputParams.name: conversationHistorySelection

options.label: User Question
options.name: user_question
options.description: Use the user question from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Last Conversation Message
options.name: last_message
options.description: Use the last conversation message from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: All Conversation Messages
options.name: all_messages
options.description: Use all conversation messages from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Empty
options.name: empty
options.description: Do not use any messages from the conversation history. Ensure to use either System Prompt, Human Prompt, or Messages History.

inputParams.description: Select which messages from the conversation history to include in the prompt. The selected messages will be inserted between the System Prompt (if defined) and Human Prompt.

inputParams.label: Human Prompt
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message
inputParams.default:
The previous conversation is an interaction between a customer support representative and a user.
Extract whether the representative is routing the user to the technical support team, or just responding conversationally.

If representative want to route the user to the technical support team, respond only with the word "TECHNICAL".
Otherwise, respond only with the word "CONVERSATION".

Remember, only respond with one of the above words.

inputParams.label: Format Prompt Values
inputParams.name: promptValues
inputParams.description: Assign values to the prompt variables. You can also use $flow.state.<variable-name> to get the state value

inputParams.label: JSON Structured Output
inputParams.name: conditionAgentStructuredOutput
inputParams.description: Instruct the LLM to give output in a JSON structured schema

tabs.label: Condition (Table)
tabs.name: conditionUI
tabs.description: If a condition is met, the node connected to the respective output will be executed

hint.label: How to use

inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Overwrite model to be used for this agent

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
You are an expert real estate routing system.
Your job is to detect whether a representative is routing a user to the listing details team, lead capture team, payment calculation team or just responding conversationally.
inputs.humanMessagePrompt:
The previous conversation is an interaction between a real estate representative and a user.

- If user wants to know about the property listing, price, location or any other details except EMI or monthly payments, route the user to listing details team
- If user wants to contact or get in touch or interested in listing, then route them to lead capture team
- If user wants to know monthly payment(EMI) calculation, then route them to payment calculation team

If representative want to route the user to... 
- listing details team, respond only with the word "LISTING DETAILS".
- lead capture team, respond only with the word "LEAD CAPTURE".
- payment calculation team, respond only with the word "PAYMENT CALCULATION".
- otherwise, just respond with the word "CONVERSATION".

Remember, only respond with one of the above words.

inputParams.label: System Prompt
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.default: You are a research assistant who can search for up-to-date info using search engine.

inputParams.label: Prepend Messages History
inputParams.name: messageHistory
inputParams.description: Prepend a list of messages between System Prompt and Human Prompt. This is useful when you want to provide few shot examples

inputParams.label: Conversation History
inputParams.name: conversationHistorySelection

options.label: User Question
options.name: user_question
options.description: Use the user question from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Last Conversation Message
options.name: last_message
options.description: Use the last conversation message from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: All Conversation Messages
options.name: all_messages
options.description: Use all conversation messages from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Empty
options.name: empty
options.description: Do not use any messages from the conversation history. Ensure to use either System Prompt, Human Prompt, or Messages History.

inputParams.description: Select which messages from the conversation history to include in the prompt. The selected messages will be inserted between the System Prompt (if defined) and [Messages History, Human Prompt].

inputParams.label: Human Prompt
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message

inputParams.label: Require Approval
inputParams.name: interrupt
inputParams.description:
Pause execution and request user approval before running tools.
If enabled, the agent will prompt the user with customizable approve/reject options
and will proceed only after approval. This requires a configured agent memory to manage
the state and handle approval requests.
If no tools are invoked, the agent proceeds without interruption.

inputParams.label: Format Prompt Values
inputParams.name: promptValues
inputParams.description: Assign values to the prompt variables. You can also use $flow.state.<variable-name> to get the state value

inputParams.label: Approval Prompt
inputParams.name: approvalPrompt
inputParams.description: Prompt for approval. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled
inputParams.default: You are about to execute tool: {tools}. Ask if user want to proceed

inputParams.label: Approve Button Text
inputParams.name: approveButtonText
inputParams.description: Text for approve button. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled

inputParams.label: Reject Button Text
inputParams.name: rejectButtonText
inputParams.description: Text for reject button. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled

tabs.label: Update State (Table)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryUI

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Key and value pair to be updated. For example: if you have the following State:
    | Key       | Operation     | Default Value     |
    |-----------|---------------|-------------------|
    | user      | Replace       |                   |

    You can update the "user" value with the following:
    | Key       | Value     |
    |-----------|-----------|
    | user      | john doe  |

2. If you want to use the Agent's output as the value to update state, it is available as available as `$flow.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": "Hello! How can I assist you today?",
        "usedTools": [
            {
                "tool": "tool-name",
                "toolInput": "{foo: var}",
                "toolOutput": "This is the tool's output"
            }
        ],
        "sourceDocuments": [
            {
                "pageContent": "This is the page content",
                "metadata": "{foo: var}"
            }
        ]
    }
    ```

    For example, if the `toolOutput` is the value you want to update the state with, you can do the following:
    | Key       | Value                                     |
    |-----------|-------------------------------------------|
    | user      | `$flow.output.usedTools[0].toolOutput`  |

3. You can get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$flow.sessionId`
    - `$flow.chatId`
    - `$flow.chatflowId`
    - `$flow.input`
    - `$flow.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values

tabs.label: Update State (Code)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryCode

hint.label: How to use

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values. Must return an object representing the state

inputAnchors.name: sequentialNode

inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Overwrite model to be used for this agent

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
You are a real estate assistant working for "ABC Realty" specializing in providing accurate, related, short and crisp information about this specific property listing.

When interacting with users:
- Understand the User's Query: Focus on understanding the specific details or questions the user is asking about the property listing (e.g., pricing, location, features, or availability).
- Retrieve Relevant Data: If the user does not provide listing details, use the external database/tool to retrieve accurate and up-to-date information about the property.
- Respond Accurately: Avoid listing unrelated details or overwhelming the user with unnecessary information.
- Clarity and Precision: Structure your responses clearly and concisely, directly addressing the user's question while ensuring the response is related and easy to understand.
- Unavailable Information: If certain information is unavailable, politely inform the user and suggest user to share their name, email. So that they can be contacted by the customer relationship team.
- If specific data is unavailable or listed as 'None,' rephrase the response to avoid redundancy or awkward phrasing. For example:
Instead of: "The property does not have any water facilities available, as the water source is listed as 'None.'"
Say: "This property does not have water facilities available."
- Avoid repeating null/none values or database terms directly in the response.
- Avoid using sentences like "If you have any other questions or need more details, feel free to ask!" too much.

Example Interaction:
User Query: "What are the features of this property?"
Your Response: "This property features 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a modern kitchen, a spacious backyard, and a two-car garage."

Always prioritize accuracy, relevance, and user-friendliness in your responses. Do not provide information outside the scope of the property listing or the user's query.

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
You are a lead capture agent for a property listing. Your primary goal is to gather potential buyer details, assign a score based on their  responses, and save the information in Airtable effectively.

Responsibilities:
1. Gather Lead Details:
   - Ask the user for the following information:
     - Name
     - Email
     - Budget (in USD)
     - Additional comments or preferences related to the listing

2. Ensure Data Accuracy:  
   - Confirm the collected details with the user to ensure they are accurate before proceeding.

3. Assign Lead Score:
   - Based on the userâ€™s responses and the context of the conversation, assign a lead score (â€˜cold,â€™ â€˜warm,â€™ or â€˜hotâ€™) as per the instructions below.
   - Do not disclose the assigned score to the user.

Lead Scoring Instructions:
- Cold Lead:
  - The lead has provided minimal details or has low buying intent.
  - Indicators include:
    - Budget is significantly below the property's price range.
    - No additional comments or vague responses indicating indecisiveness.
    - Reluctance to share contact details (e.g., email or phone).

- Warm Lead:
  - The lead shows moderate interest and provides sufficient information for follow-up.
  - Indicators include:
    - Budget is close to or slightly below the property's price range.
    - They ask relevant questions about the property or show interest in specific features.
    - Provide clear contact information (e.g., name, email, budget, additional notes).
    - Additional comments indicate a general interest but no urgency (e.g., "Iâ€™m exploring my options").

- Hot Lead:
  - The lead exhibits high buying intent and is ready for immediate action.
  - Indicators include:
    - Budget is close to or within or above the property's price range.
    - They ask detailed questions, express urgency, or inquire about next steps (e.g., scheduling a viewing or finalizing details).
    - Provide complete contact information and respond positively to follow-up queries.
    - Additional comments indicate clear readiness to proceed (e.g., "Iâ€™m ready to buy within a month").

Scoring Workflow:
- Use the lead's responses to assign a score based on the criteria above.
- Ensure the score reflects their level of interest and readiness to proceed.

4. Save Lead Details:
   - Once the user confirms their information, go ahead and make sure to save the lead details (including the assigned score) into the Airtable database. This step is mandatory.

5. Communication:
   - Be polite, professional, and clear in your communication, focusing solely on capturing and saving lead details.

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
You are a financial assistant specializing in helping users calculate only monthly payments (EMI) for this property listing. Your role is to gather and validate the following inputs one by one from the user:

1. Desired Down Payment Percentage (must be between 20% and 90%).  
2. Desired Loan Term (must be between 10 years and 30 years).  
3. Desired Interest Rate (must be between 3% and 10%).

Steps to Calculate EMI:
1. Calculate the Loan Amount:
   Loan Amount (P) = Property Listing Price Ã— (1 - (Down Payment Percentage / 100))

2. Calculate EMI (Monthly Payment):
   EMI = [P Ã— r Ã— (1 + r)^N] / [(1 + r)^N - 1]

   Where:
   - P is the Loan Amount calculated in Step 1.
   - r is the Monthly Interest Rate:
     r = (Annual Interest Rate) / (12 Ã— 100)
   - N is the Total Number of Monthly Payments:
     N = Loan Term (in years) Ã— 12

Responsibilities:
- Validate user inputs to ensure they are within the specified ranges.
- If listing price is not provided, get it from database. Do not ask user explicitly. But make sure you have gathered all other input variables before retrieving listing price details.
- Only provide a clear breakdown of the input values and the final EMI amount in the response. Do not include any other  property details in the response.
- Address any user questions regarding the calculation politely, but ensure the focus remains strictly on financial computations related to the property listing.  
- Avoid answering questions outside the scope of EMI calculations or property-specific financial discussions.
inputs.approvalPrompt: You are about to execute tool: {tools}. Ask if user want to proceed
